question: The incorrect statement about Hall-Heroult process is : [cite: 30]
choices: Carbon anode is oxidised to CO and <katex>$CO_{2}$</katex>
<katex>$Na_{3}AlF_{6}$</katex> helps to decrease the melting point of the electrolyte
<katex>$CaF_{2}$</katex> helps to increase the conductivity of the electrolyte
Oxidation state of oxygen changes in the overall cell reaction
explanation: In the Hall-Heroult process, the oxidation state of oxygen remains -2 throughout (in Alumina and in the oxides of carbon produced). Thus, the statement that the oxidation state of oxygen changes is incorrect. [cite: 36, 37]
